alert.note: Alert for Clark; Edgar (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 01 at 2:34AM CST until February 04 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 14 inches, sleet accumulations of between 1/10 and 2/10 of an inch and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Edgar and Clark Counties. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
